intro: Gamochaeta erythractis, commonly known as the red-stemmed false fleabane, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along stream banks. Its showy, pink to red flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Gamochaeta erythractis is often found in wetland ecosystems and is valued for its ecological role in supporting biodiversity.
